Most of the nurses are pretty decent but they have a lot of lazy ones who are aid-dependent. They expect good patient care with high quality when there is 1 tech to 20 patients. When asked for a raise they say it's "not in the budget". You're better off going to Target or Hobby Lobby where they value their employees and actually pay them what they are worth.

job_title: Registered Nurse, Critical Care in Fayetteville, AR
pros: Great physicians; great co-workers; nice facility; numerous patient resources (e.g., PT, OT, onsite Chaplains, palliative care, security, etc.)
cons: Terrible management. I mean literally the worst. For instance, the assistant CNO didn't like me and did not like that I had parking tickets from when I first started and didn't know where to part and kept parking in visitor parking. Well a year passed, which means the tickets rolled off. One day, I was running late, and I parked in the first spot I found, which of course was a visitor spot. This assistant CNO had security tow my car on a Friday at 2 in the afternoon. The tow place closed at 4 and if a tech hadn't offered to drive me to the tow place, I would have had to wait until Monday to get my car and pay $300 because it is $100 a night to have my car there and they are closed on the weekend. A security guard even said that they had never seen someones car get towed before and he has been working there for over 20 years. I just wanted to do my job and be happy. Apparently having experience and a good education means nothing when you park in the wrong parking spots. This assistant CNO is still there and still continues to control every aspect of that hospital. She is the puppet master of the CNO, CEO, Human Resources, and every department head of nursing. It's sick.

review_title: Best place in NWA to receive your care but not the best hospital in NWA to work.
pros: • Set schedules for this particular department with on call days every few weekends • Decent PTO/EID acuity • Decent benefits package • Up to date facility with up to date equipment • Employee discounts • Only one required working holiday a year
cons: Bad management throughout the sterile processing ladder!!!• Poor leadership!! • Unpaid holidays unless you would like to utilize your own hard owned PTOs • High turnover rate • Short staffed even at “full employee roster.” • Low pay scale for the area • No fair raises for extra certifications • Low worker morale

job_title: Executive Director Tech in Fayetteville, AR
pros: Great leadership when I was there. It was a positive work environment.
cons: Understaffed but that gave the ability to get overtime at times.

pros: Awesome Benefits! Decent Pay! Many opportunities!
cons: Hard to get your application seen

review_title: I've worked here for 25+ years and I don't think that there is a much better large employer anywhere nearby.
pros: The benefits are great and reasonably priced. They try really hard to monitor how we are perceived by our community and strive to always be better than before, even though we are consistantly rated highly in comparison with other hospitals in the country that are about the same size.They make a real effort to foster great employee moral even in these difficult economic times. Ones of the great things that they've done in recent years was to find other ways to cut costs instead of laying off employees when the economy tanked.
cons: There really aren't many cons of any consequence. The merit increases in pay are rather low but when you consider that we are a "not for profit" they are reasonable and they are enough to let employees know that they are important to the company.

review_title: Make friends with management-it will get you farther than working hard./Lax patient privacy
pros: Decent pay for the area, there are some nice hard working people here, plenty of work load, benefits offered .It's a job.
cons: Insurance deductibles are very high,upper management is very shady & dysfunctional,company is prone to large lay offs of long term employees to hire lesser paid ones,employees favored by management are not required to work as hard and those who work hard but are not only undervalued but are often written up for offenses that would not be even be mentioned to favored employees,culture reminds me of a small town high school.Patient information &  is often openly discussed within the business office with no regard for HIPPA (and not on a "need to know basis)) & I have even witnessed employees asking co workers to access the charts of others so that it can not be traced back to them. I was uneasy about being both an employee and a patient here. I have worked in several other hospitals in the area that are much more ethical.

pros: I loved my coworkers, they were great which really made a difference
cons: Management was horrible. Little communication from them, when I would bring up problems they seemed like they cared but nothing would ever change. I feel management only care about growing the hospital and no the employees in it. Will easily let an experience nurse go for a new grad, don't value their nurses or their experience they bring.

pros: Great coworkers, engaged leadership, interesting patients, and collegial physicians.
cons: Sometimes the patients are too interesting and while we all want to give the best care possible it would behoove some people to understand that this facility is not in fact a five star hotel.

pros: If you need experience you can get it there and then leave with that experience to find a better job where they’ll appreciate you and all the hard work and long hours you put in
cons: No advancement opportunities very few pay raises little to no bonuses lack of support from upper management no one answers emails all you ever hear is criticism and negativism it was the worst place I’ve ever worked

review_title: terrible to work for and mandatory 20 hours call every 2 weeks They will fire you over anything.
pros: money is OK if you work overtime. The job seemed OK at first but I could be transferred to 3 different locations in the department in a 12 hr period...NICU, post partum, or NBN. That required new charting on as many as 15 patients!!
cons:
they will NOT hesitate to report you to the board of nursing for and small mistake and you career is ruined due to a permanent red flag.I dont understand why they dont have some type of warning system instead of immediate termination 
.

pros:
Friendly environment, people who work there have been there for a long time. Not a lot of turnover.
